Author: axo777#1232
Content: Lets take the transportation supply chain.  We have a seller, a transportation company and the buyer.  Also we can have customs officers, customs brokers, quality inspectors and other government inspectors.  A normal cargo move local or international generates a lot of paperwork with its accompanying administration.  So in the normal transportation supply chain we could have maybe 15 players.  Some would be active players and others would be observers.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I need you to break that down to who is getting paid from where when

Author: Alright#0419
Content: and I can tell you whether or not you need an additional contract

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Should be able to setup auth groups with different acess levels

Author: axo777#1232
Content: I was talking with jl777 and he seemed to think that we could dispense with the db if we load the boilerplate on the clientside

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: what I'm working on shouldnt need end user to understand blockchain or get hands dirty at all. just fill in a form, send funds, and watch the output.

Author: axo777#1232
Content: pay breakdown in most cases 1 seller and 1 buyer.  The buyer pays like 30 days after delivery for domestic and on shipment for international.  But there are many variations of  these terms that we would want to have in the system

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: current format is gps specific, so would need some work to create another form for user to define data types/names

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: and other contract constraints

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: adding payment escrow will also need to be implemented, but shouldn't be too hard.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: qr codes could be used to update status of package in transit

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: could also tap into logistics tracking api where available

Author: axo777#1232
Content: In most cases the user will be the Buyer who will nominate his supplier.  We could issue a stable token against his bank deposit where the supplier would also have a account, in one scenario, then when the goods arrived inside the geofence (GPS) the CC would transfer funds , either crypto or fiat.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: unless each delivery has it's own GPS device, that could be a problem if people spoof coords. and adding a GPS to each package could be expensive unless you are talking about large shipments (e.g. sea container).

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: there's also recipient needing to sign of on state of goods on arrival to consider. damages etc.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: and I'm thinking some kind of multisig might need to come into play so all parties agree on dispersal of funds

Author: axo777#1232
Content: most goods will be palletized with boxes of barcoded or QR'd stuff riding on the pallets.  The pallets would have an RFID that is an edge device oracle to advise the blockchain.  The QR's on the pallet would be associated with the pallet RFID number and would be logged on delivery.

Author: axo777#1232
Content: Spoofing of signals has been discussed and so far not been experienced.  But I expect it to begin if crooks can figure out how to get to the money.  probably they can't.

Author: axo777#1232
Content: There will be 2 types of shipments. palletized trudkloads and LTL (less that truckload) sometimes individual packages in a van or container

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: if device reporting travels with cargo, it shouldnt be a problem

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: if we're relying on QR scans, it's much easier to fake.

Author: axo777#1232
Content: right

Author: axo777#1232
Content: for most shipments we have trailer/container loads that at this time do not have the cargo inside associated with the the shipping unit.  This turns the transportation inside out with very granular visibility of all packages from origin to destination.

Author: axo777#1232
Content: every small package goes into a larger shipping unit which can be associated with the large shipping unit

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: you could probably knock up a qr scanner which validates the location with some inbuild anti spoofing stuff.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: but i wouldnt rely on 3rd party smartphone apps...

Author: axo777#1232
Content: There are probably 200+ readers world-wide that send a signal to a nearby computer, but some of those will not know where they are, like readers in a warehouse system

Author: axo777#1232
Content: the smart phone app would be for the retail consumer to signal they have the "bread" at home and it was fresh.  We will bribe them with a few AXO's for that report

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: end user scan not an issue, as by then it's arrived üòÉ

Author: axo777#1232
Content: correct

Author: axo777#1232
Content: where the spoofing comes in is where the criminals steal a complete truck and signal that all is fine

Author: axo777#1232
Content: dishonest suppliers may be tempted to spoof with bad goods, but that is short lived and a problem for the buyers, not us

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640

Content: sounds like a plan!
